title: What to Think About Machines That Think
description:
What to Think About Machines That Think: Today's Leading Thinkers on the Age of Machine Intelligence

ISBN: 006242565X | 2015 | EPUB | 576 pages | 1 MB


As the world becomes ever more dominated by technology, John Brockmanâ€™s latest addition to the acclaimed and bestselling â€œEdge Question Seriesâ€ asks more than 175 leading scientists, philosophers, and artists: What do you think about machines that think?

The development of artificial intelligence has been a source of fascination and anxiety ever since Alan Turing formalized the concept in 1950. Today, Stephen Hawking believes that AI â€œcould spell the end of the human race.â€ At the very least, its development raises complicated moral issues with powerful real-world implicationsâ€”for us and for our machines
